newsitem.title: USA: Loral closes buy of AT&T's Skynet.
newsitem.headline: Loral closes buy of AT&T's Skynet.

text.p: Loral Space & Communications Ltd said Friday it had completed the acquisition of AT&T Corp's Skynet Satellite Services for $478.1 million.
The purchase price was adjusted downward, from an original $712.5 million, to reflect the sudden on-orbit loss of Telstar 401 in January, Loral said.
In a separate release, AT&T said it would collect $132 million in insurance proceeds for the Telstar 401 loss.

Loral Chairman and Chief Executive Bernard Schwartz said, "We are pleased to have resolved the issues raised by the loss of Telstar 401 and are enthusiastic about getting on with the business of Skynet."
Loral said it plans to expand Skynet into an international network of geostationary satellites that will connect with other networks to offer seamless multimedia access.

AT&T and Loral announced the deal last September and had expected to close in January. After the Telstar satellite's telemetry and communications abruptly stopped in mid-January, the companies started talks to renegotiate the terms of the deal.
